input.label: 11. Lowest standard taught
12. Highest standard taught
input.hint: Between 1 and 8 and greater than or equal to lowest grade

14. Number of boys enrolled in grade 2

Question for WASH, Water: Please ask these questions to the headteacher, seeking observation of the reported answers if necessary.

select1.label: W1. What is the main source of drinking water provided by the school? (Check one – most frequently used)
W2. Is drinking water from the main source currently available at the school?
W3. In the previous two weeks, was drinking water from the main source available at the school throughout each school day?
W4. Is drinking water from the main source typically available throughout the school year?
W5. Is drinking water accessible to those with limited mobility or vision?
W6. Is drinking water accessible to the smallest children at the school?

input.label: W7. How many drinking water points (e.g. taps) are at the school?

select1.label: W8. Does the school do anything to the water from the main source to make it safe to drink?
W9. If yes, what treatment method is used?

input.label: W10. If answered 'Other' to the previous question, please define.
Question for WASH, Sanitation: Please ask these questions to the headteacher, seeking observation of the reported answers if necessary.

select1.label: S1. What type of student toilets/ latrines are at the school? (check one - most common)

input.label: S2. How many student toilets / latrines are currently usable (available, functional, private)? (insert total number of holes / seats /stances )

select1.label: S3. Are the toilets/latrines separate for girls and boys?
S4. Are water and soap available in a private space for girls to manage menstrual hygiene?
S5. Are there covered bins for disposal of menstrual hygiene materials in girls' toilets?
S6. Are there disposal mechanisms for menstrual hygiene waste at the school?
S7. How many times per week are the student toilets cleaned?
S8. In general, how clean are the student toilets?
S9. Is there at least one useable toilet/latrine that is accessible to the smallest children at the school?
S10. Is there at least one usable toilet/latrine that is accessible to those with limited mobility or vision?
S11. Where are the student toilets located?
S12. When are students permitted to use the school toilets/latrines?

item.label: 1. At all times during the school day
item.value: 1.At all times during the school day

item.label: 2. During specific times during the school day
item.value: 2.During specific times during the school day

item.label: 3. There are no toilets available for use at the school
item.value: 3.There are no toilets available for use at the school

select1.label: S13. Are culturally appropriate anal cleansing materials currently available to all students?
S14. Is there currently functional lighting in the student toilets?
S15. Are latrines or septic tanks emptied (or latrines safely covered) when they fill up?

input.label: Question for WASH, Hygiene: Please ask these questions to the headteacher, seeking observation of the reported answers if necessary.

select1.label: H1. Are there handwashing facilities at the school?
H2. Are both soap and water currently available at the handwashing facilities?
H3. Are there handwashing facilities accessible to those with limited mobility or vision?
H4. Are there handwashing facilities accessible to the smallest children at the school?

select.label: H5. Where are handwashing facilities with water and soap located at the school (mark all that apply)

input.label: H6. If answered 'Other' to the previous question, please define.
H7. How many handwashing facilities with water and soap are located at the school? (insert number of taps)

select1.label: H8. How many times per week are group handwashing activities conducted for all students?

item.label: 1. At least once per school day

select1.label: H9. Which of the following provisions for menstrual hygiene management (MHM) are available at the school?
H10. How is solid waste (garbage) from the school disposed of?
